text: ah.. gotcha
<@U2H3TT8F2> have you checked the content settings?
You can change the root url for each blog under the blog menu of content settings
I've done this a number of times
and on the post-level you can also move them between blogs
I might be wrong, but doesn't that depend on the HubSpot package? I know I've run into this before on lower-budget plans
I always assume professional level package ($800/month)
With any reasonable number of contacts you're going to hit that number pretty fast in +$100 / 1k contacts anyway
(if I remember my pricing tiers correctly
its greyed out for this customer
<@U2H3TT8F2> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U2H3TT8F2/F79RC2B7S/pasted_image_at_2017_09_28_01_10_pm.png|Pasted image at 2017-09-28, 1:10 PM>
does it also have to do with where its assigned in the domain manager?
<@U2H3TT8F2> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U2H3TT8F2/F7BBSPZQE/pasted_image_at_2017_09_28_01_12_pm.png|Pasted image at 2017-09-28, 1:12 PM>

<@U38EZFVFE> so with your example, docuphase is using <http://blog.docuphase.com|blog.docuphase.com> for the blog, but could they create a second blog and assign that to <http://docuphase.com/case-studies|docuphase.com/case-studies>?
or will your only options be subdomains?
I imagine the only way to get this to work correctly is that <http://docuphase.com|docuphase.com> would have to have the blog tools associated to the main domain and not a subdomain

<@U2H3TT8F2> apologies for the slow response. I think you have some good thoughts here. This sort of all revolves around expanded user permission sets in blog authorship. Almost as if someone is "assigned" (different than author) a post, as in they are currently responsible for it. Some permissions would revolve around access to, and the ability to filter for posts your assigned to. I do also like the idea of approvals wrapping in to the composer to take comments a step further. 

Thank you for the feedback, I will certainly share with my team
<@U2H3TT8F2> This feature is oly available on enterprise level portals
And you can use any url that is attached to HubSpot.
Approval flows are something quite a few people have voiced an opinion for - I think it is a really good idea
<@U38EZFVFE> our agency portal is on enterprise and i am only able to choose from the subdomains.
Have you added the other domains to you portal?
cause i can select from a top level domain that is by default being redirected to the main domain.
thats a good point lol, we use Episerver for our main site so that may be the issue
:wink:
let me check another client
yeah.
<@U38EZFVFE> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U38EZFVFE/F7AJ872E8/screen_shot_2017-09-28_at_3.31.19_pm.jpg|Screen Shot 2017-09-28 at 3.31.19 PM.jpg>
You can see the top level domain <http://www.idatix.com|www.idatix.com>
so yeah it is available.
